words.definition: not likely to upset or harm anyone
words.example: The comment seemed innocuous at first, but later it turned out to be quite meaningful

words.definition: a small area of water, especially one that has been made artificially in a park or garden
words.example: Existing ponds need to be promoted with care and require careful maintenance.

words.definition: a long, thin piece of ice that hangs down from something
words.example: An icicle hung from the roof, sparkling in the morning sun.

words.definition: to stop something from happening or continuing
words.example: to stifle a sneeze

words.definition: to repeatedly say unkind things to someone in order to upset them or make them angry
words.example: He was taunted by his classmates because of his size.

words.definition: to move around and around quickly, or to make something do this
words.example: The mist swirled round the castle.

words.definition: the fact that something is not good enough or is too small in amount
words.example: The inadequacy of the budget is likely to cause problems.

words.definition: to expect something, or to prepare for something before it happens
words.example: to anticipate a problem

words.definition: to make large twisting movements with the body
words.example: The pain was so unbearable that he was writhing in agony.

words.definition: (a way of) being saved from danger, loss, or harm
words.example: After the diagnosis, getting to know Mary was his salvation

words.definition: to close or hold something very tightly, often in a determined or angry way
words.example: The old man clenched his fist and waved it angrily at us

words.definition: able to be happy, successful, etc. again after something difficult or bad has happened
words.example: She's a resilient girl - she won't be unhappy for long.

words.definition: to spend time considering a possible future action, or to consider one particular thing for a long time in a serious and quiet way
words.example: They were contemplating a move to California

words.definition: to spread over a large area, or (especially of things made of cloth) to become filled with air and appear to be larger
words.example: We watched the boats with their billowing sails

words.definition: annoyed, especially because you can do nothing to solve a problem
words.example: He's becoming increasingly exasperated with the situation

words.definition: a feeling of sympathy for people who are suffering
words.example: I have great compassion for those who are struggling with mental health issues

words.definition: behaviour that shows you do not care about or have any interest in someone or something
words.example: His behaviour shows a total disregard for other people.

words.definition: If two things are adjacent, they are next to each other.
words.example: They live in a house adjacent to the railway.

words.definition: to keep or continue to have something:
words.example: She has lost her battle to retain control of the company.

words.definition: to cause a liquid to change to a gas, especially by heating:
words.example: The high concentration of sugars forms a syrup when the sap evaporates.

words.definition: to prevent something bad from happening:
words.example: to avert a crisis/conflict/strike/famine

words.definition: A raspy voice sounds unpleasantly rough.
words.example: I remember his raspy voice, his laugh, and my sense of gratitude that one of the founders of my adopted field was actually sitting here talking to me.

words.definition: to gently cook a liquid or something with liquid in it so that it is very hot, but does not boil
words.example: I like to simmer the rice until it absorbs all the water.

words.definition: to hide something
words.example: She could barely conceal her irritation.

words.definition: a stick that you put under your arm to help you walk if you have injured your leg or foot
words.example: Charles was on crutches for six weeks.

words.definition: not bright or clear
words.example: He could hardly see her in the dim light.

words.definition: wanting much more of something than you need, especially money
words.example: a grasping, greedy man

words.definition: something that you agree to do or give to someone in order to end an argument
words.example: Both sides will have to make concessions.

words.definition: to make an unpleasantly loud noise:
words.example: The loudspeakers blared across the square.

words.definition: to look at someone or something with a very annoyed expression:
words.example: The boy scowled at her and reluctantly followed her back into school.

words.definition: to gradually change, or change someone or something, from one thing to another
words.example: morph into When someone brings up politics at a party, a casual conversation can quickly morph into an ugly argument.

words.definition: to ask a lot of questions in order to discover information about something or someone
words.example: The interviewer probed deep into her private life.

words.definition: smooth and shiny
words.example: glossy hair

words.definition: small, attractive, and delicate
words.example: dainty feet

words.definition: a glimmer of happiness/hope, etc
words.example: Whenever there has been a glimmer of light in the Syrian war, it has always been quickly extinguished.

words.definition: to destroy something completely
words.example: The town was obliterated by bombs

words.definition: to enjoy something
words.example: I don't relish the thought of a twelve-hour flight

words.definition: to refuse to obey someone or something
words.example: Some of these children openly defy their teachers

words.definition: to make a sound louder using electronic equipment
words.example: You know how alcohol tends to amplify certain personality traits?

words.definition: If a situation is bleak, there is little or no hope for the future
words.example: The future is looking bleak for small businesses struggling with debts

words.definition: to kill someone by covering their face with something so that they cannot breathe
words.example: I'm not gonna smother him.

words.definition: Someone's welfare is their health and happiness.
words.example: He is concerned about the welfare of young men in prison

words.definition: to make someone suffer or worry a lot
words.example: All evening the question tormented her

words.definition: to move around a place without any purpose
words.example: Gangs of youths roam the streets at night
